column1: What is the Hebrew form of nationalities?
column2: masculine: a hireq yod; feminine: a hireq yod with a tav (ית)

column1: What is the Hebrew form of traits or professions?
column2: pataḥ-dagesh-qamets pattern (e.g.,  גַּנָּב for “thief” from גנב for steal); the vowel may lengthen if it cannot accept a dagesh

column1: What is a common form of abstracts nouns / adjectives?
column2: Most words ending in וֹן, ִית, or וּת are abstract nouns or adjectives

column1: What is the form of the geminate pattern?
column2: consists of 1) A תְּ at the beginning 2) And a feminine ending
